intro: Alnus glabrata var. durangensis, commonly known as the Durango alder, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Betulaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and catkin-like inflorescences. The plant is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in high-altitude environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various wildlife species. Its ecological importance is significant in its native range, contributing to local biodiversity and ecosystem health.
